intro: Schizocarpum jaliscanum, commonly known as the Jalisco schizocarp, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers and has feathery, aromatic leaves. Its fruit is a schizocarp, splitting into two parts when mature, a unique feature of the genus. It is often found in rocky or dry habitats and is of interest to botanists due to its ecological and potential medicinal significance.
